column4: how can I watch this on Ubuntu Firefox?  http://news.ninemsn.com.au/livestreaming/sydney/
how can I watch a video website if it only offers Windows media player or Silverlight?
how can I watch this on Ubuntu Firefox?  http://news.ninemsn.com.au/livestreaming/sydney/
if I remember correctly, ninemsn audio streams are DRMed, so you can't
I can watch on IE on XP
I could be wrong on that, though =/
okay. note that IE and XP are made by Microsoft and ninemsn is 50% owned by Microsoft
so what?  is there a way to watch it?
did you not read what I just said? No, it's DRM-encumbered.
so how do I watch it on Ubuntu firefox..i know theres a way
moonlight doesn't implement silverlight's DRM scheme, so no, it isn't, hence my repeated insistence that you can't see that video in Ubuntu.
it does according to the sources
somepeople on the ubuntu forums have said it works on that website

you weren't kicked for asking. you were kicked for refusing to listen to anything you were told. And please don't say I'm "wrong" until you get it working. If you do, let me know and I'll be happy to eat plenty of humble pie.
well im glad I didnt listen to you, because your information was wrong.  the end.
